v.v: This is what the Lord Yahweh showed me. Look, a basket of summer fruit!
He said, “What do you see, Amos?” I said, “A basket of summer fruit.” Then Yahweh said to me,
The songs of the temple will become wailings in that day—
Listen to this, you who trample the needy
This is so we can sell bad wheat, buy the poor with silver,
Yahweh has sworn by the pride of Jacob, “Surely I will never forget any of their actions.”
Will not the land quake for this,
I will turn your festivals into mourning
They will stagger from sea to sea;
In that day the beautiful virgins
Those who swear by the sin of Samaria

v: “The end has come for my people Israel;
I will spare them no longer.
this is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh—
many dead bodies, they are thrown everywhere!
Silence!”
and remove the poor of the land.
“When will the new moon be over,
so we can sell grain again?
When will the Sabbath day be over,
so that we can sell wheat?
We will make the measure small
and increase the price,
as we cheat with false scales.
and the needy for a pair of sandals.”
and every one who lives in it mourn?
All of it will rise up like the Nile River,
and it will be tossed about and sink again,
like the river of Egypt.
this is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh—
that I will make the sun set at noon,
and I will darken the earth at daylight.
and all your songs into lamentation.
I will make all of you wear sackcloth
and have baldness on every head.
I will make it like mourning for an only son,
and a bitter day to its end.
this is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh—
when I will send a famine in the land,
not a famine for bread,
nor of thirst for water,
but for hearing the words of Yahweh.
they will run from the north to the east
to seek the word of Yahweh,
but they will not find it.
and the young men will faint from thirst.
and say, ‘As your god lives, Dan,’
and, ‘As the way to Beersheba exists’—
they will fall and never rise again.”
